We're working on more stories right now
Inside the House leadership scramble.

                Getty

            By 
Lauren French

09/28/15 05:33 PM EDT
Kansas Republican Rep. Lynn Jenkins has announced she’ll run for chair of the House Republican Conference if the current leadership scramble creates a vacancy. 
In an email to members on Monday, Jenkins, the current vice chair of the conference, said the party must “unite” to advance conservative principles. 
“I am uniquely suited to serve, given the opportunity, as your chair of the House Republican Conference. And as always, my number one priority will be ensuring your needs as a conference are met, and I promise not a day will go by where I do not listen and learn from you to maximize our conference’s ability to advance and communicate our conservative values,” Jenkins wrote.
Rep. Cathy McMorris Rodgers (R-Wash.) is the current chair of the Republican conference but is considering making a bid for majority leader. Jenkins said she would only run if there was a vacancy.
To bolster her candidacy, Jenkins touted her experience as vice chair and her position on the influential Ways and Means Committee.
North Carolina Rep. Renee Ellmers and Indiana Rep. Luke Messer are also considering a run for conference chairman. 
 © 2015 POLITICO LLC
description: She says the party must “unite” to advance conservative principles.
title: Jenkins announces bid for conference chair
orgs: American Coalition for Clean Cal Electricity
